pkgmetadata.longdescription: Design of High-Order Portfolios Including Skewness and Kurtosis // The classical Markowitz's mean-variance portfolio formulation ignores heavy tails and skewness. High-order portfolios use higher order moments to better characterize the return distribution. Different formulations and fast algorithms are proposed for high-order portfolios based on the mean, variance, skewness, and kurtosis. The package is based on the papers: R. Zhou and D. P. Palomar (2021). "Solving High-Order Portfolios via Successive Convex Approximation Algorithms." arXiv:2008.00863. X. Wang, R. Zhou, J. Ying, and D. P. Palomar (2022). "Efficient and Scalable High-Order Portfolios Design via Parametric Skew-t Distribution." arXiv:2206.02412.
